intro: Goeppertia ecuadoriana, commonly known as the Ecuadorian calathea, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of Ecuador. It belongs to the Marantaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful, and patterned leaves. The plant typically grows as an understory species, thriving in humid, shaded environments with high atmospheric moisture. Its leaves are often adorned with intricate veining and vibrant hues of green, pink, and purple. Goeppertia ecuadoriana requires well-draining soil and consistent watering to flourish in cultivation.
